title: How am I supposed to play Jhin and learn him when this keeps happening

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

replies.body:
i feel like gifing this wasn't necessary and you literally could have just said "how am i supposed to play jihn when he keeps getting banned" 

the answer is blind pick

Happening to me every game - wasted 7300 IP and 1350 RP on someone I have a 10% chance of playing. Either someone bans Jhin, or someone on EITHER team picks him before me.  Riot should totally stop the fact if someone picks someone, shouldn't mean no one on the enemy team can have them.

> [{quoted}](name=Horidas,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=O4IKaLyg,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-02-05T04:31:27.987+0000)
>
> Happening to me every game - wasted 7300 IP and 1350 RP on someone I have a 10% chance of playing. Either someone bans Jhin, or someone on EITHER team picks him before me.  Riot should totally stop the fact if someone picks someone, shouldn't mean no one on the enemy team can have them.

That's literally what draft pick is for. Play blinds if you want that.

How are there still people who are shocked that a newly released champ will get spammed the first week?  This isn't a big shocker. If you don't like it, wait a week.

"Riot should totally stop the fact if someone picks someone, shouldn't mean no one on the enemy team can have them."

This has been an aspect of draft/ranked pick since forever. It makes "draft picks" meaningful. If you don't like it, don't play draft.
